title: ماسك يدمج أعمال الفضاء والذكاء الاصطناعي في كيان واحد
summary: يسعى الملياردير الأميركي إيلون ماسك لدمج مشروعاته في استكشاف الفضاء والذكاء الاصطناعي في شركة واحدة قبل الطرح العام الأولي الضخم المخطط للشركة لاحقا هذا العام.

title: A huge cloud of dark matter may be lurking near our solar system
summary: For the first time, researchers have found what seems to be a cloud of dark matter about 60 million times the mass of the sun in our galactic neighbourhood

title: The best new science fiction books of February 2026
summary: We pick the sci-fi novels we’re most looking forward to reading this month, from a new Brandon Sanderson to the latest from Makana Yamamoto

title: Our verdict on Annie Bot: This novel about a sex robot split opinions
summary: Members of the New Scientist Book Club give their take on Sierra Greer's award-winning science-fiction novel Annie Bot, our read for February – and the needle swings wildly from positive to negative

title: ترامب يقاضي الضرائب والخزانة بسبب تسريب بياناته المالية
summary: رفع الرئيس الأميركي دونالد ترامب دعوى قضائية ضد كل من مصلحة الضرائب ووزارة الخزانة الأميركيتين مطالبا بمبلغ 10 مليارات دولار، حيث يتهم الوكالتين الاتحاديتين بالفشل في منع تسريب معلوماته الضريبية إلى وسائل الإعلام.

title: New study highlights Apple Watch’s role in AFib monitoring after treatment
summary: A new trial suggests Apple Watch could make a meaningful difference in what happens after atrial fibrillation ablation, not by changing the procedure itself, but by changing what patients and doctors catch afterward. Researchers found that a simple routine of patient-led ECG check-ins surfaced more…

title: Think of a card, any card – but make it science
summary: Feedback has been informed about a "global telepathy study" which is currently taking place, but isn't entirely convinced about its merits

title: SpaceX’s Starlink dodged 300,000 satellite collisions in 2025
summary: The company’s mega-constellation is having to perform a huge number of manoeuvres to prevent a collision in Earth orbit

title: Filming the universe’s biggest dramas: Best ideas of the century
summary: Astronomers used to rely on chance to catch a glimpse of fleeting explosions in space. A fresh approach to watching these flashes has completely transformed astronomy
